intro: Cacalia linifolia, commonly known as the slender bluebell, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30 to 60 centimeters, with slender stems and finely divided leaves. Its flowers are usually blue or purple, blooming in late spring to early summer. Cacalia linifolia is often found in rocky soils and open woodlands, where it thrives in full sun to partial shade.
